dt: {bc}one who shows qualities (such as pluck, endurance, or determined energy) attributed to the defenders of ancient Troy
{bc}a merry and often irresponsible or disreputable companion

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}trojanus{/it} of Troy, from {it}Troia, Troja{/it} Troy, from Greek {it}Trōïa{/it}
shortdef: a native or inhabitant of Troy
one who shows qualities (such as pluck, endurance, or determined energy) attributed to the defenders of ancient Troy
a merry and often irresponsible or disreputable companion

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or resembling ancient Troy or its inhabitants
{bc}of, relating to, or constituting a Trojan horse

shortdef: of, relating to, or resembling ancient Troy or its inhabitants
of, relating to, or constituting a Trojan horse

dt: {bc}someone or something intended to defeat or subvert from within usually by deceptive means
{bc}a seemingly useful computer program that contains concealed instructions which when activated perform an illicit or malicious action (such as destroying data files)
{bc}the concealed instructions of such a program {dx}compare {dxt|virus||3}{/dx}

et: from the large hollow wooden horse filled with Greek soldiers and introduced within the walls of Troy by a stratagem
shortdef: someone or something intended to defeat or subvert from within usually by deceptive means

a seemingly useful computer program that contains concealed instructions which when activated perform an illicit or malicious action (such as destroying data files); also : the concealed instructions of such a program

dt: {bc}a 10-year war between the Greeks and Trojans brought on by the abduction of Helen by Paris and ended with the destruction of Troy

shortdef: a 10-year war between the Greeks and Trojans brought on by the abduction of Helen by Paris and ended with the destruction of Troy
